posts.title: Cincinnati police fatally shot an armed 18-year-old. The next day, his father killed a sheriff’s deputy, authorities say | CNN
top_comments:
To be clear, the sheriff that was killed was not connected to the shooting of the 18 year old.  The father snapped and ran over a sheriff directing traffic.  He watched the body cam video of his son's death and lost it.

Sad day for everyone involved

The Sheriff that was killed was doing traffic duty for university of Cincinnati graduation. Heard he was close to retirement.

Edit: already retired and was just helping with traffic

So a guy is killed by police while brandishing a firearm in the commission of a felony and his father responds by murdering a cop who had nothing to do with it, yeah that family sounds like a great value to society

*"police did recover a handgun with an extended magazine attached near the man who was shot. A second magazine was found in the man's sweatshirt pocket."*

After they had stolen a car and were confronted by police mind you.

A pretty justified shooting by police it seems.

seems most just read the headline and move on.  Killed kid was with three other kids who stole a car got in a police chase then wrecked.  All got out and ran and one of the kids had a gun which the police saw and yelled gun.  

Video

[https://www.wcpo.com/news/local-news/cincinnati/east-price-hill/cpd-cincinnati-police-involved-in-shooting-no-officers-injured](https://www.wcpo.com/news/local-news/cincinnati/east-price-hill/cpd-cincinnati-police-involved-in-shooting-no-officers-injured)

  
non-issue if the kids would have never stolen the car.
It's not a crime to be armed in Ohio. Gun rights activists should be outraged the cops shot this kid for expressing his rights.

Almost like “1 bad apple ruins the whole barrel.” This is a great example of why it would benefit “good cops” to align themselves with police reform/abolition movements.  

As long as police face impunity when they murdered citizens, every police officer is in danger of rage-induced crimes of retribution. 

To be clear, the officer murdered was not involved in the murder of the son. But he’s dead now, because he chose to align himself with a fascist police state. 

RIP to the victims.

*Hinton Jr.’s son was armed and fleeing from a stolen vehicle when a responding officer fatally shot him, police said. Police body cam footage does not clearly show whether the fleeing man pointed a gun at the officer.  The family reviewed the footage between 10 a.m. and 11 a.m. Friday, and the father was “very distraught..."*

The innocent police officer is still alive if this shooting doesn't happen. How does one flee and aim a gun at the same time, esp in split seconds.  And the driving crime happened right after the father saw the footage. But it's going to be very bad for him on one more front--because of his very disturbed state.

>“I do have a plea to everybody. Let the processes play out. Let the investigations play out. Keep calm, take care of one another and I can assure you, as the chief of police for Cincinatti, I will ensure you transparency and a thorough and accurate investigation,” Theetge said.

At worst to intentionally sabotage the government, the dollar, the country, and modern western society.

"He doesn't really mean it"  

Yeah none of us are laughing now...more like screaming in terror.
All of these things are traps set for anyone in the future who would try to fix the damage: they would have to spend a LOT of money to restart all these programs.

Cut all funding to science, thus stifling the innovation and invention that drives the economy.
If you don't have a sense for scale, this is IMO the biggest news in weeks. Smart people can't do stuff without their NSF grants. Wow.
"Hell is empty, and all the devils are here."
Wow, I don't think ppl understand the gravity of this news. Sadly, without scientists they won't have anyone to explain it to them either. This would shutdown most University STEM research programs.
Every day delayed is a week lost. Every week delayed is a month lost. Every month delayed is a year lost. Every year delayed is a decade lost.

"requires that grants be screened for “alignment with agency priorities" 


Basically, if it's not Trump or Republican aligned then it's not happening.

top_comments: “Modern Americans behave as if intelligence were some sort of hideous deformity.” - Frank Zappa
I will never understand why people deliberately endanger their children with a preventable disease

Learning about immune amnesia from the measles is sobering. 

Essentially, wiping up to 73% of antibodies knowledge from ALL previous immune knowledge events (vaccinations, previous infections, babies putting everything in their mouths to kids recovering from illness, etc). Taking on average 2-3 YEARS for the previous level of immune protection knowledge to be restored.  Please consider inviting a conference of knowledge to your immune system. Our bodies need this information ahead of time.


https://hms.harvard.edu/news/inside-immune-amnesia

Next EO, measles will now be called Freedom Freckles.

The US is going to lose its eradication certification, and the rest of the world will be alerted and issue travel warnings, which in turn will further hurt the tourism industry. Americans will also be subject to heightened scrutiny when traveling. 

These are not opinions. This is how science works.

absolutely no correlation whatsoever. https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/under-trump-national-science-foundation-cuts-off-all-funding-to-scientists/

top_comments: Can someone explain to me how Trump is able to legally not spend money Congress has apportioned? Does this mean a Democrat could come in and just fire all federal workers who only do work in red states?

"New requests for investigations of firefighter injuries and workplace health hazards had already stopped being accepted. A CDC plan to help Texas schools curb the spread of measles infections was also scrapped due to the layoffs. 

NIOSH employees receiving layoff notices late Friday included some workers for the World Trade Center Health Program, miner safety, and firefighter health programs" 

This shit gets worse every day.  Trash country full of trash people.
Finally I can work without a helmet, safety glasses and harness. /s

My blue collar dad used to talk about how unsafe his work was until the government started forcing the company to be safer. 

Can't help but wonder if companies are going to revert back.
What’s wild is how much this agency does to help firefighters and protect their long term health.  most firefighters are big time Trump supporters.
I remember working construction in 2005 or so. I would wear a mask and ear plugs doing that nasty indoor shit now. Live and learn. But we want to reverse progress again.
Don’t forget. No respirators or PFT’s any more. Let’s fill our lungs with silica for profit!!!

Here's one most of you will call a lie, but one of my coworkers (I'm retired now) had worked at a chemical plant that made vinyl chloride, and back in the 40's-50's they had to send men inside those tanks to clean them when necessary. 

The way the company did it was to lower naked men into the tank and scrape material off the sides until their scrotums started to burn.

They would bring them out, send them to shower and lower more naked guys in.

He was told this by much older and longer tenured guys when he worked there in the early Eighties.

What annoys me is how republicans in blue states probably won't hurt quite as much from stuff like this, so they'll keep benefitting from blue state protections and thinking Trump is doing a great job.
Why does the right hate firefighters so much?

The family reviewed the footage between 10 a.m. and 11 a.m. Friday, and the father was “very distraught..."*

posts.title: Former Illinois Gov. George Ryan dies at 91. He halted executions and went to prison for corruption
top_comments: TLDR; Former Illinois Governor George Ryan passed away on May 2, 2025, at the age of 91 in Kankakee, Illinois, while under hospice care. A Republican known for his pragmatism, Ryan served as governor from 1999 to 2003. He gained international recognition for halting executions and commuting all death row sentences in Illinois, citing systemic injustices in the capital punishment system. However, his career was marred by a corruption scandal dating back to his tenure as secretary of state, leading to a 2006 conviction for racketeering, bribery, extortion, money laundering, and tax fraud. He served over five years in federal prison and was released in 2013.
Didn't have to mention that an Illinois governor went to prison for corruption.  It's just implied.

A relative met him and he was quite kind, goofy, and grandfatherly - at a time when we had just lost ours. It's a shame he marred his name with corruption. IL's 'wiretap' laws (all party consent everywhere audio recording) basically exist to protect this kind of crap, so it's no wonder IL's history of corruption is long and deep.
If you are a top politician in Illinois and not engaging in corruption are you really even trying?
I’m glad Illinois has held their governors accountable, but so many of them have been criminals that it’s kinda funny at this point.
At the time, I cynically though that clearing death row was a bid for some kind of legacy to distract from licenses for bribes. The ordering of his obituary suggests it worked.
He was absolutely correct about the death penalty.
What is it with Illinois and politicians going to jail?
You just have to say Illinois Governor. Went to prison for corruption is assumed.
A good example of the dialectic of the human being.  somebody can both do a lot of good things, and also do bad things. I would argue this is most human beings.
